page.title: 09A275 LEWES TO CHAILEY ROAD
page.content: The{picturesque}A275 main Lewes to Chailey road passes through the western edge of this block. The road was improved{in the 18th {century as a turnpike:}Toll Cottage in Offham was the place to pay. In the 20th century more and more cars use the road. It is very busy now, with {over 11000 vehicles daily.}Since the cross_channel port was developed at Newhaven and especially since the UK joined the EEC the number of heavy lorries has increased and the level crossing at Cooksbridge causes traffic jams.{Many accidents have happened}to pedestrians along this road as there is no speed limit in or crossing in Cooksbridge. A{'lollipop lady'}helps children to cross but only just before or after school. Parents are {campaigning to have a pelican crossing installed.
